summary: Adds HDT physics to the Lady of Death armor.
descriptionHtml:
[center][heading][color=green]-Introduction-[/color][/heading][/center]
I quite like the [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/13761/?]Lady of Death[/url] armor mod, but I thought it could use a makeover using HDT physics.
While I was at it, I created some new Inventory meshes for it.

[center][heading][color=green][size=3]-NerevarineKhajiit Presents-[/size][size=4]
Lady of Death - HDT[/size][/color][/heading][/center]
Using the power of [url= http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/49015/?]Bodyslide 2 and Outfit Studio[/url]  (and with help and inspiration from chronotrigger77, author of [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/25259/?]Remodeled Armor for CBBE Bodyslide and TBBP HDT[/url]), this mod converts the Lady of Death armor and corset to the newest version of CBBE, with HDT. It also includes some optional files that will add new Inventory meshes to replace the skull mesh the original mod used.


[center][heading][color=red][b]- PLEASE READ THE ENTIRE DESCRIPTION BEFORE DOWNLOADING -[/b][/color][/heading][/center]
[center]You should always know exactly what you're downloading and putting into your savegames. [/center]

[center][heading][color=green]-Mod Demonstration-[/color][/heading][/center]
[center][color=green] Video Demonstration[/color][/center]
[center][youtube]B9bTGPfqxuo&feature=youtu.be&hd=1?vq=hd1080[/youtube][/center]

[center][heading][color=green]-What's the difference between this and the original mod?-[/color][/heading][/center]
The original mod is only fit to the regular CBBE body, and will be completely rigid when worn, even if you're using HDT physics. Additionally, the original mod uses a Skull as a placeholder for the inventory mesh, so you don't see the armor until you're wearing it.
My mod applies HDT physics using [url= http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/49015/?]Bodyslide 2 and Outfit Studio[/url] with inspiration drawn from [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/25259/?]Remodeled Armor for CBBE Bodyslide and TBBP HDT[/url]. Now the armor and corset will appropriately scale with the body, jiggle where appropriate, and otherwise match the CBBE body with HDT physics enabled. I also used nifskope to mock up some inventory meshes so you can ogle the armor while its in your inventory.

[center][heading][color=green]-How do I use it?-[/color][/heading][/center]
Pretty much the exact same way as the original mod. Use the console commands or craft it.


[center][heading][color=green]-Help! I’ve got a problem.-[/color][/heading][/center]
There are a few bugs with the inventory meshes, specifically when you drop the armor. The mesh clips terribly with the floor, and you may not even be able to see most of the armor. However, I don't really consider this much of a problem because I don't really think many people will be laying this armor all over their room.


[center][heading][color=green]-Does this modify anything else?-[/color][/heading][/center]
No. It doesn't touch your skeleton, your body replacer, or even the gloves, boots, and cloak that came in the original mod. This will only touch the Armor peice and Corset.

[center][heading][color=green]-Requirements and Suggestions-[/color][/heading][/center]
This mod requires:

[list][*][url=http://skse.silverlock.org/]SKSE[/url][*][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/601/?]Realistic Ragdolls and Force[/url] (It's a requirement of XPMS)[*][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/26800/?]XPMS Extended[/url] (Be sure to get the Extended 2.x version, not any of the 1.x versions) Let it overwrite Realistic Ragdolls.[*][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/53996/?]HDT Physics Extensions[/url][*][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/2666/?]CBBE[/url][*][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/13761/?]Lady of Death[/url][/list]
Strongly recommended to use with this mod:
[list][*][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/25259/?]Remodeled Armor for CBBE Bodyslide and TBBP HDT[/url][/list]

If you use any texture replacers for CBBE, be sure to install those AFTER all of the required files, so that the textures aren't overwritten.
If you use any custom body shapes in BodySlide, remember to run it with this armor to get it to fit correctly.


[center][heading][color=green]-Future of the Mod-[/color][/heading][/center]
I may add HDT physics to the cloak at some point, and I'm looking into making variations of this armor so that it's more useful late-game.

[center][heading][color=green]-Installation-[/color][/heading] [/center]
This mod comes packaged in a fomod installer. It is strongly recommended that you use NMM, or a fomod compatible mod installer. [color=red]Make sure you have the required files installed first![/color]
Let it overwrite the original mod.
If you want to manually install, you should have a pretty good idea of how to do it, so I will not provide instructions.

[center][heading][color=green]-Uninstallation-[/color][/heading][/center]
Simply deactivate using your mod install software.
[color=yellow]This mod does NOT add save-changing scripts or mess with any NPCs.[/color]

[center][heading][color=green]-Version History-[/color][/heading][/center]
[list][*]1.0- Initial Release. HDT physics added to Armor and Corset, Inventory meshes for both, and Bodyslide/Outfit Studio files for customization[/list]

[center][heading][color=green]-Permissions-[/color][/heading][/center]
Do [b]not[/b] upload this mod to any other site, or to the Steam Workshop. Steam Workshop is great for other games, but with a game as complicated and easy-to-crash as Skyrim, the Workshop is shoddy at best, and I do not support modding through it.
This mod is based on newermind43's work. If you make anything using this mod, you will also need permissions from newermind43.
